intro: Hieracium variable var. angustilobum, commonly known as narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with basal leaves that are lanceolate to ovate in shape. Its flowers are usually yellow, with a central disk surrounded by pale yellow to white ray florets. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and woodland edges.
